rules.ruleString: Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {ACS1002, ACW1002, AFG1002, AFW1002} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS}
Must be enrolled in course type {10, 41, 50}

time: Summer semester A (starts November) 2017 (On-campus block of classes)

description: This unit covers various aspects of financial accounting and builds on the principles introduced in AFW1002/ACW1002. The unit reviews and further analyses the Conceptual Framework and Preparation and Presentation of Financial Statements, with a focus on its application to specific IFRS. This unit introduces IFRS topics, such as revenue recognition; provisions and contingent liabilities/assets; events after the reporting period; accounting policies, estimates and errors; and borrowing costs. The unit further explores the recognition, measurement and disclosure requirements for various categories of assets including accounting for: inventories; property, plant and equipment; impairment of assets; intangible assets; investment property; and non-current assets held for sale and discontinued operations.
